DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ok, I guess I've got a minute.
RESPONSE TEXT: My family's lived in this town going back generations. Far as I can tell, we've been here as long as it has.

RESPONSE TEXT: Even after the bombs dropped, my folks worked hard to keep the town together and drive out any threats.
We did such a good job that before I was even born, this place was one of the safest towns in the commonwealth. And soon everyone forgot how to be cautious.
SCRIPT NOTES: Proud then a little irritated / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: I begged the town council to let me train the militia, to teach the citizens how to shoot and fend for themselves. But they thought I was just paranoid.
SCRIPT NOTES: Upset no one would listen to him / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I knew something was coming, I just didn't know what. And when the mirelurks started rising out of the ocean, no one was ready.
SCRIPT NOTES: He was so sure, but no one listened / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: I saved as many as I could, sniping crabbies from my roost upstairs. But for every one I saved, three were goners.
SCRIPT NOTES: Sad he couldn't do more to help / Apologetic

RESPONSE TEXT: That was a couple of year ago. Ever since then, I've vowed to protect this town, and I don't plan on breaking that vow.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: People will come back, Barney.
SCRIPT NOTES: Determined, the problems of the past won't happen again / Stern

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: People will come back, Barney.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Barney: All right, enough chit chat. You've got a job to do, so go do it!

DIALOGUE AFTER: Barney: All right, enough chit chat. You've got a job to do, so go do it!

DIALOGUE AFTER: Barney: Barney Rook, commander of the Salem Volunteer Militia, at your service. I'm also the quartermaster, sergeant at arms, and scribe for all official meetings.

Before you showed up, the Mirelurks had been mostly quiet. And those that were a problem were quickly dispatched by my turret defense system.
Since things had been quiet lately, I took the turrets offline to conserve ammunition.  Obviously, they need to be reactivated.
And that's your mission, soldier. I'm going to continue to hold down the home front while you go reactivate the turrets.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sounds good.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sounds good.
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course it sounds good, I'm a tactical genius. Smartest man in town, as a matter of fact.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Barney: The turrets should be easy enough to find. They're up high in strategic locations around town.
